void load (in string uicommand)

Detailed Description

This interface allows a component to specify a class-name and (potentially) arguments that get passed out to a user-interface for further processing.

In past Ccaffeine demo's it has come handy for popping up specialized input or output visualization windows.

Member Function Documentation

void ccaffeine.ports.GUIService.load (  in string  uicommand  ) 
 

send a string to the ccaffeine UI.

e.g. "gov.cca.anl.norris.UIMain arg1 arg2 arg3"

Parameters:
uicommand string routed to the ccaffeine ui. if that ui happens to be the ccaffeine GUI (or another one supporting this interface, a load event is generated that is handled by ./user_iface/gui/guicmd/Gui.java (or equivalent) in the following way:
  • uicommand is broken up into words.
  • the first word is a java classname.
  • An instance of the classname is created (null constructor).
  • If widget is a CcaffeineGUIWidget (see user_iface/gui/CcaffeineGUIWidget.java) the rest of the words are delivered as a String[].
  • If widget is a Runnable, gui starts it in a new thread.
  • If widget is a javax.swing.JInternalFrame,JApplet,JFrame, then it gets added to ccaffeine gui hierarchy.
  • Additional mechanisms for delivering arg1 arg2 arg3 may be specified by new implementations of this interface.
  • In the above steps, anything exceptional just gets ignored.
  • In the ccafe-gui implementation, if the classname is not a CcaffeineGUIWidget, the extra words in the uicommand are ignored.
